site_name: RUBY FUR FARM, I N C

citations.narrative:
One wire enclosure, containing three raccoons, has a sharp pointed wire approximately 1 inch long inside the enclosure
pointed over the food/water bowl. Sharp points could cause injury to the raccoons.
The housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. The licensee must remove the
sharp points or alter them in a manner that eliminates the risk of injury to the animals. The licensee must ensure that the
enclosures are safe for the animals at all times.
The licensee removed the sharp point at the time of the inspection.

There is a significant buildup of wild bird feces on a wood board above at least one outdoor enclosure housing one adult
striped skunk. The facility did remove the bird feces from above the enclosure at the time of inspection. Avian pests and
exposure to their fecal material may create a disease hazard or cause the animals to become soiled. The facility must
establish and maintain a safe and effective program to control insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Paige Johnson, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
One wire enclosure, containing three raccoons, has a sharp pointed wire approximately 1 inch long inside the enclosure 
pointed over the food/water bowl. Sharp points could cause injury to the raccoons.  
The housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. The licensee must remove the

3.131(d)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
There is a significant buildup of wild bird feces on a wood board above at least one outdoor enclosure housing one adult 
striped skunk. The facility did remove the bird feces from above the enclosure at the time of inspection. Avian pests and 
exposure to their fecal material may create a disease hazard or cause the animals to become soiled. The facility must 
establish and maintain a safe and effective program to control insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors:
